_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management, and employees of Loida Ag Service, LLC are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur,  the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Perry County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.  

3.  Accident Release Prevention Program.  This facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our State Regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.

4.  Five-Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during the past five-years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program.  Loida Ag Service do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.  Loide Ag Service has provided state and local authorities the informaation required by EPCRA and the CAA Section 112r.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility.  We conduct yearly safety meetings, safety equipment checks and, check of emergency spill equipment and procedures.  There are no additi
onal specific anhydrous ammonia safaety recommendations at this time.
